original: Ekholm, Anders Gustaf Ragnar, rektor, Linköping, f. 22/10/92 i Kniv-sta, Sthlms 1., av stat:insp., kapt. Gustaf E. o. Lilly Bruun. G. 25 m. Dagmar Mellbin. Barn: Gustav f. 30, Blenda 32, Ingvar 34. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 11, fil. kand. där 14, fil. mag. 17, fil. lic. 21, fil. dr 24, res:off:ex. 16, provår i Upps. 20-21. Res. t. Tyskl., Frankr., Ital, Estl. o. Lettl. 14, 21, 22 o. 23. Timlär. v. Upps. h. elem:-lärov. o. gymn. f. fl. 21-28, v. Fjell-stedtska sk. 21-26, lär. v. Upps. ensk. lärov. o. privrgymn. 24-28, lektor i modersm. o. tyska v. Västerviks h. a. 1. sed. 28, rektor där 31-41, v. Linköp. h. a. 1. sed. 41. Tf. und:visn:råd vissa tider 36-37, 38-39 samt senare. Led. av iStadsfuLlm. i Västervik 31-41, i Linköp. sed. 43 m. m., v. ordf. i Upps. stud :kår 22-23. Skr.: Samuel Coilumibus (24), Antikens, medeltidens o. renässansens litt. (i Kunskap 29), art. i Samlaren, Sv. biogr. lex., Psyk.-pedag. uppslrbok, Belimansstud. m. fl. RNO.
translated: Ekholm, Anders Gustaf Ragnar, principal, Linköping, born October 22, 1892 in Knivsta, Stockholm, son of state inspector, Captain Gustaf E. and Lilly Bruun. Married on May 25th to Dagmar Mellbin. Children: Gustav born in 1930, Blenda in 1932, and Ingvar in 1934. Completed his high school studies in Uppsala in 1911, Bachelor of Arts in 1914, Master of Arts in 1917, Licentiate of Philosophy in 1921, and Doctor of Philosophy in 1924. Completed his military training in 1916 and a probationary year in Uppsala from 1920-1921. Traveled to Germany, France, Italy, Estonia, and Latvia in 1914, 1921, 1922, and 1923. Worked as an hourly teacher in Uppsala elementary and high schools from 1921-1928, at Fjellstedtska school from 1921-1926, teacher at Uppsala private high school and gymnasium from 1924-1928, teacher of the mother tongue and German at Västervik high school from 1928, principal there from 1931-1941, principal at Linköping high school since 1941. Temporary advisor of education at certain times from 1936-1937, 1938-1939, and later. Member of the city school board in Västervik from 1931-1941, and in Linköping since 1943, among others. Vice Chairman of the Uppsala student council from 1922-1923. Published works include "Samuel Columbius" in 1924, "Literature of Antiquity, the Middle Ages and the Renaissance" in 1929, articles in "Samlaren", "Swedish Biographical Dictionary", "Psychological-Pedagogical Handbook", "Belimansstud", among others. Received the Order of the North Star.

employer.name: Uppsala Private High School and Gymnasium

employmentHistory.jobTitle: Teacher of the Mother Tongue and German
